tool.name: Bindingsite
tool.description: : This class finds the binding site of the input_pdb.

param.name: input_pdb_path
param.label: input PDB file
param.help: Path to the PDB structure where the binding site is to be found. Format: [input].pdb

param.name: input_clusters_zip
param.label: input ZIP file
param.help: Path to the ZIP file with all the PDB members of the identity cluster. Format: [input].zip

param.name: outname_output_pdb_path
param.label: output PDB name
param.help: Path to the PDB containig the residues belonging to the binding site Format: [output].pdb

param.name: sele
param.label: Take tool settings:
param.help: Select where tool settings are to be read from

param.name: properties
param.label: Configuration file
param.help: File containing tool settings. See below for the syntax

param.name: jsonstr
param.label: JSON string
param.help: JSON string containing tool settings. See below for the syntax

param.name: ligand
param.label: ligand
param.help: Ligand to be found in the protein structure. If no ligand provided, the largest one will be selected, if more than one.

param.name: radius
param.label: radius
param.help: Cut-off distance (Ã…ngstroms) around ligand atoms to consider a protein atom as a binding site atom.

param.name: max_num_ligands
param.label: max_num_ligands
param.help: Total number of superimposed ligands to be extracted from the identity cluster. For populated clusters, the restriction avoids to superimpose redundant structures. If 0, all ligands extracted will be considered.

param.name: matrix_name
param.label: matrix_name
param.help: Substitution matrices for use in alignments.
